title.narrative: SWE-2012-156: Development of fruit fly control strategies in pro-poor growth
SWE-2012-156: Development of fruit fly control strategies in pro-poor growth

description.narrative: Development of fruit fly control strategies in pro-poor growth. In less than a decade the African invasive fruit fly (AIF) has invaded large parts of the afro-tropical region, jeopardizing food security and economic development. It is the major threat to high-value fruit production. Its devastating effect on fruit production and its rapid spread throughout Africa necessitates immediate action. Here we propose to develop and implement bait technology in integrated management of AIF in larger scale production and smallholder farming benchmark sites. The outcome of the research aims to benefit both smallholder farmers, as well as larger scale fruit production. The objectives are: 1. Develop an effective lure for female AIF, utilizing our identified fruit and AIF semiochemicals. 2. Optimization of lures for field application and use in baseline population dynamics study. 3. Monitored intervention at smallholder and large-scale benchmark sites.

Development of fruit fly control strategies in pro-poor growth. In less than a decade the African invasive fruit fly (AIF) has invaded large parts of the afro-tropical region, jeopardizing food security and economic development. It is the major threat to high-value fruit production. Its devastating effect on fruit production and its rapid spread throughout Africa necessitates immediate action. Here we propose to develop and implement bait technology in integrated management of AIF in larger scale production and smallholder farming benchmark sites. The outcome of the research aims to benefit both smallholder farmers, as well as larger scale fruit production. The objectives are: 1. Develop an effective lure for female AIF, utilizing our identified fruit and AIF semiochemicals. 2. Optimization of lures for field application and use in baseline population dynamics study. 3. Monitored intervention at smallholder and large-scale benchmark sites.
